Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior: glazed black; exterior: lip glazed; in handle zone, black-figure decoration consisting of two horsemen galloping to right: left horse in added white with added red mane and forelock, red on rider’s upper torso; right horse’s hindquarters with red on flank with part of rider’s right leg and arm (possibly some white on waist); below, glazed area.
Curator's comments: The sherd probably belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.593.b.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.31)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 397, no. B581)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0531) (Phase 1)
